page.title: 14LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Contours formed by Corallian ridge SW at Rood Ashton to North. Common Hill, Cold Harbour and edge of Great Hinton dropping to NW clay vale. Part of Rood Ashton House, former Long family seat now renovated, is surrounded by parkland, lake and two lodges with Home Farm nearby. Adjoining is Green Lane Wood, ancient forest remnant. Paxcroft brook runs through lower Paxcroft Farm partially draining the Common, with roads bounded by straight thorn hedge Enclosure Act fields. The fringe of Keevil village includes school, Manor and their farms. Steeple Ashton is dominated by splendid Perpendicular Church. Timber framed, brick and limestone houses are grouped round village green,market cross and lock up.A landscape much changed by loss of elms,hedge removal,increased arable and house building.
